snippet: Rory McIlroy was leading by four strokes heading into the final round of last year’s Masters. What happened next is the stuff of bad legends.
abstract: Rory McIlroy, who is practicing for upcoming Masters Golf Tournament, recalls his final round at last year's event in which he finished 10 strokes behind the winner Charl Schwartzel; two months later, McIlroy went on win the United States Open by eight strokes.
lead_paragraph: Rory McIlroy was leading by four strokes heading into the final round of last year’s Masters. What happened next is the stuff of bad legends.

headline.seo: McIlroy Back at Site of Masters Meltdown
headline.main: McIlroy Takes a Trip Down Misery Lane
headline.print_headline: McIlroy Recalls Meltdown In Trip Down Misery Lane
